title: Edge Computing Term Gains Traction
overview: Processing moves closer to end users and devices to cut latency and backhaul costs, setting the stage for edge runtimes and global, stateful apps.

title: AWS Lambda@Edge
overview: AWS extends serverless to the CDN edge so code can run in response to viewer/origin events, enabling personalization and security at the edge.

title: Cloudflare Workers
overview: Cloudflare launches Workers, a lightweight JavaScript runtime on its global network, making compute at the edge accessible to web developers.

title: Fastly Compute@Edge (Developer Preview)
overview: Fastly brings a high-performance WASM-based edge compute platform, targeting low-latency dynamic content and programmable networking.

title: Durable Objects for Edge State
overview: New primitives like Durable Objects introduce coordination and state at the edge, enabling realtime apps without centralized regions.

title: Fly.io & Global App Placement
overview: Fly.io popularizes globally distributed apps running close to users, with per-region placement and private networking.

title: Vercel Edge Functions
overview: Vercel adds Edge Functions for frameworks like Next.js, letting developers render pages and APIs at the edge with minimal config.

title: AI Inference at the Edge
overview: Edge platforms begin integrating on-device/model inference and vector search, enabling personalization and privacy-preserving experiences.
